messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] me, out of town, Thursday to Sunday
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/3/02 7:13:14 AM, GSmith8995@aol.com writes:  Yep, and it
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/3/02 7:13:14 AM, GSmith8995@... writes:

<< Hurricane? What hurricane? Houston is absolutely gorgeous this morning! >>

Yep, and it stayed that way. No rain, no wind. I was hoping at LEAST for
some exciting rain.

Sandra, back in the desert

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/2/2002 11:18:40 PM Eastern Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:


> And I've never seen a
> hurricane (not that I'll get to, y'know) and so it will be educational.
>
>

Having survived Hurricane Hugo in Charleston, SC, hurricane season always
freaks me out a little. Sending good thoughts to everyone in Lili's path....
Amy Kagey

messages.subject: me, out of town, Thursday to Sunday
messages.msgSnippet: No doubt I ll check mail another couple of times but if Southwest Airlines is willing to go to Houston with a storm coming, I m going! Here s my speaking
messages.messageBody:
No doubt I'll check mail another couple of times but if Southwest Airlines is
willing to go to Houston with a storm coming, I'm going!

Here's my speaking schedule:

Saturday 8:30- 9:30- Learning (or Remembering) How to Learn Sandra Dodd
Keynote Saturday 12:30- How Unschooling Will Change the World


My kids are all squared away to take care of themselves some because my
husband has a big busy season at work. My van needs to be in the shop anyway
(Again) so my being gone for a few days is good. And I've never seen a
hurricane (not that I'll get to, y'know) and so it will be educational.

Or I might just see the inside of Love Field airport in Dallas for a long
long time and then come back to Albuquerque!

But anyway, if anyone's wondering why I'm not here, that's why.

Sandra
